      • doInBackground

        protected java.lang.Boolean doInBackground(java.lang.Void... params)
        Since we are retrieving data from the database we need to do it asynchronously so it doesn't interfere with the app and with what the user is doing at the moment of retrieving the data.
        Specified by:
        doInBackground in class android.os.AsyncTask<java.lang.Void,java.lang.Void,java.lang.Boolean>
        Parameters:
        params - Void.
        Returns:
        Boolean array containing only one element, this is going to be used by the onPostExecute(final Boolean success) method.
        See Also:
        AsyncTask.onPreExecute(), AsyncTask.onPostExecute(Result), AsyncTask.publishProgress(Progress...)

      • getId

        private int getId(java.lang.String name)
        Basically this function just returns the id of the city, if no city was found the the function will return -1.
        Parameters:
        name - This is the name of the City, based on that we can get the id of the city.
        Returns:
        The id of the city that corresponds to the name sent as an argument.

      • preparePurchase

        private Purchase preparePurchase(Purchase purchase)
        This function prepares the instance of the object Purchase so it can be sent to the database hosted on Firebase. It sets all the information needed.
        Parameters:
        purchase - This instance is the one that is going to be changed.
        Returns:
        Purchase object with all corresponding information.
        See Also:
        Purchase
